scenario:
Wall Street's Q4 earnings season begins next week with notable names such as JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo, Citigroup, BlackRock, Bank of America, Goldman Sachs, UnitedHealth, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing reporting their financial results. Analysts expect annualized profit growth of +11.9% and an increase of +4.6% in revenue growth.

The sector is expected to report the largest annualized earnings growth rate of all eleven sectors, at +39.5%, with high-profile companies such as JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, Wells Fargo, Citigroup, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Visa, Mastercard, and American Express.

The sector is forecast to report the second-highest annualized earnings growth rate, at +20.7%, with companies such as Meta Platforms, Alphabet, Netflix, Walt Disney, Comcast, Verizon, and AT&T.

The sector is expected to report the third-highest annualized earnings growth rate, at +14%, with tech giants such as Apple, Nvidia, Microsoft, Broadcom, Salesforce, Oracle, Cisco, ServiceNow, and IBM.

In contrast, earnings from the sector, which includes oil and gas giants such as ExxonMobil, are expected to tumble -24.6% compared to last year, the worst drop of any sector by far.

The sector is projected to report the second-worst Y-o-Y earnings slump of all eleven sectors, with EPS set to decline -3.8% from a year earlier.

In terms of revenue expectations, analysts have decreased their estimates during the quarter, with the S&P 500 expected to report annualized sales growth of +4.6%, compared to expectations for revenue growth of +5.2% at the end of September.

Eight sectors are projected to report year-over-year growth in revenues, led by the Information Technology and Utilities sectors, at +11.1% and +8.0%, respectively.

Thirty-eight stocks are forecast to deliver growth of more than 25% in both earnings per share and revenue, including tech-related names such as Astera Labs, Nvidia, Coinbase, and Snowflake.

Some other notable stocks to watch for that are also projected to deliver double-digit Q4 earnings and sales growth include Eli Lilly, Newmont, Jeffries Financial, Blackstone, Prudential Financial, Affirm, and On Holding.
